qas.question: What is the name of Comcast's channel available to subscribers in east coast markets?
What is the name of Comcast's subscriber channel in Colorado?
In what year did Comcast Entertainment take over operation of Colorado's Emergency Alert System?
What New York area sports channel did Comcast help found in 2006
What baseball team was Comcast's partner in their New York sports network?
When did the channel become available in New York, Pittsburgh, and Richmond?
When did Comcast partner with Altitude Sports & Entertainment?
What is the name of the Emergency Alert System in Philadelphia?
What did Comcast and the Mets creat in 2004?
What is the name of Time Warner Cable's variety network?

context: Comcast also owns many local channels. Comcast also has a variety network known as <a0_0><b9_0>Comcast Network<b9_0/><a0_0/>, available exclusively to Comcast and Cablevision subscribers. The channel shows news, sports, and entertainment and places emphasis in Philadelphia and the Baltimore/Washington, D.C. areas, though the channel is also available in New York, Pittsburgh, and Richmond. In <b5_0>August 2004<b5_0/>, Comcast started a channel called <a1_0>Comcast Entertainment Television<a1_0/>, for Colorado Comcast subscribers, and focusing on life in Colorado. It also carries some National Hockey League and National Basketball Association games when Altitude Sports & Entertainment is carrying the NHL or NBA. In <b6_0>January <a2_0>2006<b6_0/><a2_0/>, <b7_0>CET<b7_0/> became the primary channel for Colorado's Emergency Alert System in the Denver Metro Area. In 2006, Comcast helped found the channel <a3_0><b8_0>SportsNet New York<b8_0/><a3_0/>, acquiring a minority stake. The other partners in the project were <a4_0>New York Mets<a4_0/> and Time Warner Cable.
